Chana Masala

Description

Chana Masala, a popular North Indian dish, is a delectable and aromatic curry made with chickpeas (chana) cooked in a flavorful blend of spices. This vegan and gluten-free dish showcase the rich tapestry of Indian cuisine, offering a perfect balance of earthy chickpeas and a robust, well-spiced tomato-based gravy. To prepare this dish, start by sautéing onions, ginger, and garlic in oil until golden brown. Add a medley of ground spices, such as cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, which infuse the chickpeas with layers of savory and aromatic notes. Tomatoes, both fresh and canned, contribute to the luscious base of the curry, creating a harmonious blend of tanginess and sweetness. Simmer the chickpeas in this flavorful concoction until they absorb the essence of the spices, resulting in a hearty and satisfying Chana Masala. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve it over rice or with warm, pillowy naan for an authentic and comforting Indian dining experience.

Ingredients

  • 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
  • 1 large onion, finely chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1-inch ginger, grated
  • 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon ground coriander
  • 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
  • Salt to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish
  • Lemon wedges for serving

Steps

  1. In a large pan, sauté the chopped onion in oil until golden brown. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for an additional minute.
  2. Stir in the ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Cook the spices for 2-3 minutes to enhance their flavors.
  3. Add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste, simmering until the mixture thickens.
  4. Incorporate the drained chickpeas into the tomato-spice mixture, coating them evenly. Add salt to taste.
  5. Allow the Chana Masala to simmer on low heat for 15-20 minutes, allowing the chickpeas to absorb the flavors.
  6. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve the Chana Masala over rice or with naan. Squeeze a lemon wedge over the curry before enjoying this hearty and flavorful Indian dish.
